data.name: Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Plasma Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

data.name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Positive Spark
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.name: Qwilfish

attacks.name: Offensive Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

data.name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Lap Up
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.

data.name: Walrein

abilities.name: Freeze-up
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Walrein from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may flip 2 coins. If both are heads, discard 1 of the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ice Bind
attacks.text: If your opponent doesn't discard a card from his or her hand, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

data.name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Jolteon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

data.name: Magcargo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Crushing Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard the top card of your deck. If it's a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lava Flow
attacks.text: Discard any amount of basic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Burning Magma-GX
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Psychic Exchange
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

data.name: Finneon
data.flavorText: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They're popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.

data.name: Musharna

attacks.name: Dream of Memories
attacks.text: Shuffle 3 cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Dream Dance
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

data.name: Inkay

attacks.name: Ink Spit
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Attack and Hide
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. You may shuffle Gengar GL and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Leap Out
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

data.name: Metagross-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magnetic Laser
attacks.text: You may move a Metal Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Squared Attack
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Venipede

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

data.name: Beldum

attacks.name: Reaction
attacks.text: You may switch Beldum with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground's natural magnetism, letting it float.

data.name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

data.name: Regirock-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Regi Power
abilities.text: The attacks of your Fighting Pokémon (excluding Regirock-EX) do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bedrock Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Spearhead
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

data.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It seems that other Pokémon's efforts to take its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused Chansey to get faster at fleeing.

data.name: Swanna

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

data.name: Snorunt

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It's only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Slightly Simmer
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and discard them. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

data.flavorText: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

data.name: Groudon ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.text: As long as your opponent has Kyogre, Kyogre ex, Rayquaza, or Rayquaza ex in play, Groudon ex's attacks do 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Mix-Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent discards the top card from his or her deck.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: Lives about three feet underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

data.name: Light Dewgong

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Ice Pillar
attacks.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, as long as Light Dewgong is your Active Pokémon, prevent all damage done by attacks to your Benched Pokémon. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: It has an aerodynamic shape that allows it to swim at great speeds. The colder the water gets, the more active it becomes.

data.name: Arbok

abilities.name: Intimidating Pattern
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool; it is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

data.name: Grimer

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

data.name: Malamar

attacks.name: Entangling Control
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Trash Tentacle
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

data.name: Dark Primeape

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.text: If Dark Primeape does any damage while it's Confused (even to itself), it does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Frenzied Attack
attacks.text: Dark Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: Although Primeapes have always been mean, lately they seem to be becoming even more vicious and frenzied.

data.name: Aipom

attacks.name: Grab
attacks.text: Choose a Trainer card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.

data.name: Electivire

attacks.name: Steel Short
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Metal Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.

data.name: Shedinja

abilities.name: Resent
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Shedinja would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon and each of the opponent's Pokémon that has the same name as the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Curse and Deceive
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If Shedinja has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one's spirit.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from Erika's Gloom. If Erika's Gloom has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Magic Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).

abilities.name: Reversal Aura
abilities.text: As long as you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, each of Hariyama's attacks does 20 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance) and damage done by the Active Pokémon to Hariyama is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Brick Smash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Joltik

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

data.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Electro Diffusion
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Electrode. Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electrode.

data.flavorText: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Nidorino.

data.name: Voltorb

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A life-form whose identity is unknown. It is said to Screech or suddenly Self-Destruct.

data.name: Whiscash

attacks.name: Fury
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Whiscash.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is very territorial. It repels foes by setting of tremors that extend over a three-mile radius.

data.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

data.flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

data.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Farfetch'd's Leek Slap attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: During your next turn, Farfetch'd can't use Leek Slap.

data.flavorText: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

data.name: Machamp

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Reinforced Lariat
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Onix can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out.

data.name: Skiploom

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.

data.name: Plusle

attacks.name: Tag Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If Minun is on your Bench, draw 4 more cards.

attacks.name: Positive Ion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

data.name: Regice

abilities.name: Icy Barrier
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Shelgon

abilities.name: Energy Guard
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any basic Energy attached to it, it takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: They lurk deep within caves—motionless, neither eating nor drinking. Why they don't die is not known.

attacks.name: Messenger
attacks.text: Put Koga's Pidgey and all cards attached to it on top of your deck. Then search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card not named Koga's Pidgey. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Abomasnow

attacks.name: Ice Age
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

data.name: Umbreon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Call-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Jet Stream
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Blastoise is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to Blastoise, if any. Then, if there are any Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon, choose 1 of them and discard it. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Cannon
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy Cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Lonely Fang
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 20 damage times the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon minus the number of your Benched Pokémon. (For example, if your opponent has 3 Benched Pokémon and you have 1, this attack will do 30 damage plus 40 more damage.)

data.name: Houndour

attacks.name: Team Hunt
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your Houndour in play.

data.flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Darkness Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Sharpedo.

abilities.name: Frost Wind
abilities.text: As long as Glaceon is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ice Bind
attacks.text: If your opponent doesn't discard a card from his or her hand, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Combee

attacks.name: Enraged Assault
attacks.text: If Vespiquen is on your Bench and has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a thousand, packed closely together in a lump.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

data.name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Barraskewda

attacks.name: Targeted Skewer
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each damage counter on that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

data.name: Corsola

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Corsola or this attack does nothing. Remove all damage counters from Corsola.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.

attacks.name: Cracking Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

data.name: Swablu
data.flavorText: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

data.name: Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

data.name: Raichu

abilities.name: Evoshock
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.

data.name: Magby

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Magby is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Magby by attacks.

attacks.name: Play with Fire
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Magby is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don't underestimate it.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Electrispark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Dusclops

attacks.name: Roam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gravity Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that doesn't have a Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.

data.name: Uxie

attacks.name: Memory Skip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

data.name: Vikavolt-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Zap Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigatron-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

data.name: Sandile

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

data.name: Whirlipede

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

data.name: Machamp

attacks.name: Seething Anger
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on Machamp. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

data.name: M Metagross-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gatling Slug
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Gabite

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Big Storm
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium in play.

data.flavorText: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Blizzard

data.flavorText: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Froakie

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Grovyle

attacks.name: Greenness
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

data.name: Emolga

attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dump and Draw
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from your hand. Then, draw 2 cards for each Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Cranidos

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.flavorText: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.

abilities.name: Dense
abilities.text: Any damage done to Quagsire by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: You shouldn't get close to the child when it's playing outside its mother's pouch. Its mother is always nearby watching over it.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Dual Brains
abilities.text: During your turn, you may play 2 Supporter cards.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.

abilities.name: Glowing Screen
abilities.text: As long as Volbeat is in play, any damage done to Illumise by attacks from Fighting Pokémon and Darkness Pokémon is reduced by 30. You can't reduce more than 30 damage even if there is more than 1 Volbeat in play.

attacks.name: Chaotic Noise
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Crabominable

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

data.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Eerie Impulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Hard Protection
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to Shelgon by attacks from your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Wormadam

attacks.name: Twin Bursts
attacks.text: If Mothim is on your Bench, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

data.name: Manectric

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to Manectric and this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

data.name: Miltank

attacks.name: Milk Drink
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Remove 2 damage counters times the number of heads from Miltank. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.

data.name: Lumineon

attacks.name: Neon Trickery
attacks.text: You may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.

data.name: Seaking

attacks.name: Ripping Horn
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent draws a card.

data.flavorText: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.

data.name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

data.name: Charizard G LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Charizard G. Charizard G LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Call for Power
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Charizard G. This power can't be used if Charizard G is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Malevolent Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy attached to Charizard G.

data.name: Glalie

attacks.name: Ice Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed, and discard an Energy from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Frosty Typhoon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Frosty Typhoon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It freezes its prey and chews them whole. However, it prefers to eat Pokémon like Vanillite that are already frozen.

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Parental Fury
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.

data.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

data.name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

data.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Sinister Suggestion
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her next turn, treat it as tails.

data.flavorText: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.

abilities.name: Water Cyclone
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water Energy card from your Active Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Kingdra is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rapids
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Keldeo

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.

data.name: Buizel

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.

data.name: Noctowl

abilities.name: Glaring Gaze
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Noctowl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.

data.name: Houndoom

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Attack Operation
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

data.name: Minun

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Electrishower
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Burning Fire
attacks.text: When you use this attack, you may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to your Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Kabuto by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Team Assembly
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, or any Basic Pokémon and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.

data.name: Porygon2

abilities.name: Mapping
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Porygon2 from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: 3-D Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Further research enhanced its abilities. Sometimes, it may exhibit motions that were not programmed.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Kyogre

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Grand Wave
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Grand Wave during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

data.name: Frogadier

attacks.name: Water Duplicates
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Frogadier and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

data.name: Decidueye-GX

attacks.name: Hollow Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.text: Shuffle 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a stinging sensation when it licks enemies.

data.name: Rayquaza ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.text: As long as your opponent has Kyogre, Kyogre ex, Groudon, or Groudon ex in play, Rayquaza ex's attacks do 40 damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dragon Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

data.name: Sandslash

abilities.name: Dig Down
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 5 cards in your deck. Choose as many Fighting Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Sandslash is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

data.name: Tierno
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Panpour

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Wishiwashi

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and return it to your hand. You can't use this Ability during your first turn or on the turn this Pokémon was put into play.

data.flavorText: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

data.name: Treecko

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

data.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Mirror Mirror
attacks.text: Each player either draws or discards cards until that player has 4 cards in his or her hand. (Your opponent does this first.)

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

data.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Night March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon in your discard pile that have the Night March attack.

data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

data.name: Salamence-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dragon Lift
abilities.text: Your Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost, except Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Jet-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Although it has become capable of living on land, it spends its time in the water, where its prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.

data.name: Mesprit

abilities.name: Silent Waves
abilities.text: If you have Azelf in play, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Resistance.

attacks.name: Mind Splash
attacks.text: If Uxie is on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

attacks.name: Spontaneous Explosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage and Koga's Weezing does 30 damage to itself; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Toxic Cloud
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

data.name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Positive Ion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Chinchou during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Chinchou is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

data.name: Garchomp C LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Garchomp C. Garchomp C LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Healing Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Garchomp C LV.X from your hand onto your Active Garchomp C, you may remove all damage counters from each of your Pokémon SP.

attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Garchomp C. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Garchomp C can't use Dragon Rush during your next turn.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: It converses with others by magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

abilities.name: Miraculous Powder
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Butterfree is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 2 damage counters from Butterfree.

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Double Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

data.name: Thundurus

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Disaster Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

data.name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

data.flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

data.name: Victini

attacks.name: V-blast
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It creates an unlimited supply of energy inside its body, which it shares with those who touch it.

abilities.name: Sand Armor
abilities.text: If Hippowdon E4 has any Fighting Energy attached to it, any damage done to Hippowdon E4 by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bite and Crush
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Muk

attacks.name: Poison Suction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sludge Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's so stinky! Muk's body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Aqua Wash
attacks.text: You may put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.flavorText: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

abilities.name: Self-healing

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderspark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon with at least 1 Energy card attached to it (yours and your opponent's).

abilities.name: Flash Bite
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Crobat G from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

abilities.text: As long as you have Volbeat in play, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Illumise by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has Dark in its name.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Asleep (after doing damage).

data.name: Sealeo

attacks.name: Freezing Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Be it Spheal or a Poké Ball, it will spin any round object on its nose with the greatest of ease.

data.name: Shelgon

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shelgon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dragon Bump
attacks.text: If Shelgon has any basic Fire Energy and any basic Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Manectric.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Wild Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

data.name: Snover

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

data.name: Emolga-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Glide
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you attached Energy in this way, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electron Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Wingull

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.

data.name: Torkoal

abilities.name: White Smoke
abilities.text: As long as Torkoal is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects, including damage, done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Black Soot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

data.name: Galvantula

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spider Thread
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

data.name: Haunter

abilities.name: Gothic Fear
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. That Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim's life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.

data.name: Eevee

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card to Eevee, flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee that is the same type as the Energy card you attached to Eevee. Attach that card to Eevee. This counts as evolving Eevee. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Eevee is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its irregularly configured DNA is affected by its surroundings. It evolves if its environment changes.

data.name: Bayleef

attacks.name: Evolution Impulse
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Leaf Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.

data.name: Pikachu V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Monferno

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mid-air Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

data.name: Doduo

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

data.name: Garchomp

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Royal Blades
attacks.text: If you played Cynthia from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

attacks.name: Loving Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent has in his or her hand.

attacks.name: Sweet Temptation
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Altaria

abilities.name: Miraculous Charm
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX.

data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

data.name: Hypno

attacks.name: Hand Control
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a Supporter card you find there. If you do, your opponent plays that Supporter card. However, you make all decisions for that card. (That Supporter card is discarded.)

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.

attacks.name: Energy Powder
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Toxic Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Gnawing Curse
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.

data.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Curiosity
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

attacks.name: Spin Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.

data.name: Jynx

attacks.name: Whiny Voice
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

attacks.name: Feverish Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

data.name: Light Flareon

attacks.name: Warm Up
attacks.text: If you have any benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of them. Then shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Flame
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Light Flareon or this attack does nothing. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It creates its flames by swallowing air into a special pouch within its body, then heating it to over 3000 degrees.

data.name: Mime Jr.

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Mime Jr. is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Mime Jr. by attacks.

attacks.name: Sleepy Lost
attacks.text: Put the top card of your opponent's deck in the Lost Zone. Mime Jr. is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy's movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!

data.name: Flaaffy

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Flaaffy does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Elekid

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Outlet
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Shelgon.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Palm Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Spirited Throw
attacks.text: If Hariyama has fewer remaining HP than the Defending Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 80.

data.flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

data.name: Throh

attacks.name: Freestyle Strike
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Shoulder Throw
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 20 damage for each Colorless in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

data.name: Oricorio

attacks.name: Feather Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Pom-Pom Punch attack's base damage is 100.

data.flavorText: This Oricorio has sipped bright yellow nectar. Its bright, cheerful dance melts the hearts of its enemies.

data.name: Joltik

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

data.name: Keldeo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Rush In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Secret Sword
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Conduction
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Lanturn. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Aron.

data.name: Stunky

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

data.name: Dark Rapidash

attacks.name: Flame Pillar
attacks.text: You may discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Dark Rapidash when you use this attack. If you do and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A wild, uncontrollable Pokémon. When running, it looks like a comet streaking through the sky.

attacks.name: Advanced Armor
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Silcoon by your opponent's Evolved Pokémon.

data.name: Carnivine

attacks.name: Drawup Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It walks around on its tentacles in search of a tree branch where it can dangle down and ambush prey.

data.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

data.name: Doduo

attacks.name: Double Headstrike
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.

data.name: Shinx

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

data.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap Thunder
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out this Pokémon and attach it to one of your Lightning Pokémon as a Special Energy card. This card provides 2 Lightning Energy only while this card is attached to a Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

data.name: Zekrom-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Strong Volt
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

abilities.name: Ripples
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Mantine). This power can't be used if Mantine is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: Mantine can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Dustox

attacks.name: Hazardous Scales
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Burned, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Toxic powder is scattered with each flap. At night, it is known to strip leaves off trees lining boulevards.

data.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Big Yawn
attacks.text: Both Slowbro and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Madkinesis
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to Slowbro.

data.flavorText: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.

data.name: Azelf

attacks.name: Psychic Abduction
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Shuffle 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit and Azelf all came from the same egg.

data.name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Kabuto Armor
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

data.name: Walrein

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Frozen Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It shatters drift ice with its strong tusks. Its thick layer of blubber repels enemy attacks.

data.name: Togekiss

attacks.name: Powerful Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Double Voltage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

data.name: Hatenna

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

abilities.name: Photosynthesis
abilities.text: All Energy cards attached to Erika's Oddish provide Grass Energy instead of their usual type. This power works even while Erika's Oddish is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Mothim

abilities.name: Disturbance Scales
abilities.text: Any damage done by attacks from your Pokémon to the Defending Pokémon isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Get Help
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of different types of Wormadam on your Bench.

attacks.name: Quick Touch
attacks.text: You may switch Mothim with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Mothim as you like to the new Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.

data.name: Stunky

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Scyther can't use this attack during your next turn. (Benching or evolving Scyther ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

abilities.name: Ion Coating
abilities.text: You may use this power once during each of your turns (before your attack). All Lightning Energy attached to your Active Pokémon becomes Water Energy for the rest of the turn. (This effect ends if your Active Pokémon retreats or is returned to your hand.) This power can't be used if Lanturn is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Electric Tackle
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Lanturn. Flip a coin. If tails, Lanturn does 10 damage to itself for each Lightning Energy attached to it.

abilities.name: Sunbeam
abilities.text: The maximum HP for each Lunatone you have in play is now 80.

attacks.name: Scorching Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Reflected Beam
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon for each Lunatone you have in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Helioptile
data.flavorText: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Tentavolve
attacks.text: If Tentacruel evolved from Tentacool during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.

data.name: Shinx

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

data.name: Torchic

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

data.flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

data.name: Entei

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of their deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

data.name: Jynx

abilities.name: Victory Kiss
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may heal 10 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

data.name: Wormadam Plant Cloak

attacks.name: Magical Needle
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cloak Scale
attacks.text: If you have Wormadam Sandy Cloak in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.

data.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Swirly Rush
attacks.text: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl are on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: It's quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its time on land.
